alert.note: Alert for Amite; Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 7:23PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Helena, northeastern East Feliciana, northern Tangipahoa and west central Washington Parishes, southwestern Pike and southern Amite Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 721 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gillsburg, or 10 miles north of Greensburg, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensburg, Amite City, Kentwood, Centreville, Roseland, Osyka, Montpelier, Darlington, Mount Herman, Felps, Gillsburg, Easleyville, Wilmer and Tangipahoa. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 48 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
